title: Night Out: Human Trafficking DOCU at Kennicott
address: Jefferson Memorial Park, 4822 N. Long Ave., Chicago IL         60630
description: Come and watch 'Dreamcatcher', an inspirational documentary centered on the story of the founder of the Dreamcatcher Foundation and her fight against human trafficking.    Dreamcatcher   -  A documentary film directed by Kim Longinotto focusing on Brenda Myers-Powell, a former prostitute who runs Dreamcatcher Foundation, a charity which helps women in Chicago leave the sex industry. The film won the World Cinema Directing Award in the documentary category at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival.

title: Night Out: Motivation and Inspiration at Kenwood
address: Kenwood Community Park, 1330 E. 50th St., Chicago IL         60615
description: Jamiah On Fire & the Red Machine is a local band made up of three cousins.Jamiah On Fire And The Red Machine is a local youth band made up of three cousins. ages 19,16 and 14. The band has been together for seven years and performs throughout the chicagoland area. Jamiah on fire and the Red Machine is a success story and supports the fact the kids can do great things!

title: Night Out: Kaleidoscope at Berger
address: Berger Park Cultural Center, 6205 N. Sheridan Rd., Chicago IL         60660
description: Join the Art Institute of Chicago for art making and family fun.The Kaleidoscope Festival turns 20! To celebrate this decades long tradition at the Art Institute of Chicago, we're extending our reach to families and teens within 4 communities across the city for art making and family fun, free for all. Join us at a park near you!

title: Night Out: Color Balloon Fight at Barrett
address: Barrett Park, 2022 W. Cermak Rd., Chicago IL         60608
description: Come in light-colored clothing, battle it out with dye-filled water balloons, and leave in a rainbow of colors. Come in light-colored clothing, battle it out with dye-filled water balloons, and leave in a rainbow of colors. It's a massive water balloon fight! Canvas backdrops set up around the park will also be dyed during the event, making large-scale works of tie-dye-esque art. Plus, a documentary film class will record the proceedings and create a fun, short video.

title: Night Out: We Are Hip Hop at Dvorak
address: Dvorak Park, 1119 W. Cullerton St., Chicago IL         60608
description: The 10th Annual We Are Hip Hop Youth Festival is a youth-curated event featuring a lineup of spoken word artists, a graffiti battle, a breakdance battle, and more.The 10th Annual We Are Hip Hop Youth Festival is a youth curated event featuring a line-up of spoken word artists, a graffiti battle, breakdance battle and more. The event is free and open to the community. The festival fosters unity and peace through positive Hip Hop culture and principles.
